title: UPDATE 1-Brazilian F-5 fighter crashes near Rio, pilots eject
text:
May 24, 2018 / 2:03 PM / Updated 11 minutes ago UPDATE 1-Brazilian F-5 fighter crashes near Rio, pilots eject Reuters Staff 2 Min Read
(Adds pilots survived, role of F-5 in Brazilian Air Force)
RIO DE JANEIRO, May 24 (Reuters) - A Brazilian Air Force F-5 fighter jet crashed in the Rio de Janeiro metropolitan area shortly after takeoff on Thursday, but the two pilots ejected before the aircraft plummeted to the ground, the Air Force said.
The fighter ran into trouble shortly after departing the Santa Cruz Air Force base west of Rio de Janeiro, according to an Air Force statement.
The pilot and co-pilot of the twin-jet fighter were picked up and taken to the hospital for exams, as investigators inspected the crash site to find out what caused the accident, the Air Force said on Twitter.
The F-5 built by Northrop was first designed for use by the United States in the Korean war in the mid-1950s to face Russian Mig-15s. Brazil bought around 60 of the fighters in the 1970s and 1980s.
The refurbished F-5s are the mainstay of the Brazilian Air Force since it retired its Mirage 2000s in 2013. It has been awaiting delivery of 36 Gripens from Swedenâ€™s Saab AB . (Reporting by Rodrigo Viga Gaier Writing and additional reporting by Anthony Boadle Editing by Chizu Nomiyama and David Gregorio)
